subject: Hey, Santa
event:
All I want for Christmas is the C-57-D.

http://cgi.liveauctions.ebay.com/324-Orig-flying-saucer-miniature-from-Forbidden-Planet_W0QQcmdZViewItemQQ_trkparmsZ72Q3a1205Q7c66Q3a2Q7c65Q3a12Q7c39Q3a1Q7c240Q3a1308Q7c301Q3a1Q7c293Q3a1Q7c294Q3a50QQ_trksidZp3286Q2ec0Q2em14QQhashZitem230308881625QQitemZ230308881625QQptZLHQ5fDefaultDomainQ5f0

Never was a cooler spaceship, except maybe for the Orbit Jet (you can keep your Enterprise and Millenium Falcon).  And from the bestest SF movie ever made.  Not to mention some classic episodes of the original Twilight Zone.  Klaatu's saucer just can't compare.

Damn.  If only I'd finished DANCE.  I might be able to afford it.

comments.article: One can only imagine what goes through the thoughts of the prop guys who made those things when these items come up for auction.  "We spent only $ making that and it's going for $$$$$??!"

comments.upictitle: A Rake at the Gates of Hell: House
comments.article: Really, it's pretty...but as against the Enterprise?  I think not.  (I agree, the Falcon is overrated.) ;-)
The C-57-D never made the Kessel Run in Under 12 Parsecs I'll wager!

comments.upictitle: A Rake at the Gates of Hell: House
comments.article: It can, however, outrun the local bulk cruisers.
Somewhere, in Sci-fi heaven, Forrest Ackerman (bless him) is counting his pennies to see if he could bid.
...if you finish the book before I die I'll steal the damn thing for you.
comments.subject: I swear to God...

comments.article: You shouldn't sell yourself so low! He should finish the entire series before you die if you're gonna steal for him. ;)
comments.subject: Re: I swear to God...

comments.article: I can picture that floating around before the camera on a string that you aren't supposed to see, but can just the same. I love those old Sci-Fi shows before CGI - they're so hokey - something like you might see now on Mystery Science Theater 3000.
except that i don't think MST3K has been around for a while
Ugh, that link is ruining my friends page. For some reason it gets render as one really long line.

comments.upictitle: This is all a dream we shared one afternoon.: ah ha ha ha ha
comments.article: You'll shoot your eye out, kid! HOOOOOOOOO HOOOOOOOOOOOO HOOOOOOOOOO!
Funny you say that, I asked Santa for Dance and all I got was this weird spaceship thing from some TV show! :O
comments.subject: Dance

comments.article: Watch out for coal in your stocking! :)
comments.subject: If Santa is a Song of Ice and Fire fan...

comments.article:
There are Rocky Jones episodes floating around on the Internet. Very cool.

The XV-2 is a nice futurist design, although it has a bit of a Bell experimental supersonic aircraft look to it. Apparently the V-1 bombs were a major design influence, but I'm suspicious of the Bell connection.

The C-57-D's is very shiny, certainly. Great film, too, which JMS is bringing to the big screen again with the help of Joel Silver, though in a not-a-remake, not-a-reimagining, not-exactly-a-prequel sort of way. Huh.

I admit, I'm partial to the Enterprise-D (The Next Generation) with the curves and organic shape. Going further back, though, it's all about Pal's War of the Worlds. Even if they aren't accurate to the description in the book, they're ominous, sleek killing machines.
You mean you aren't a multi-gazillionaire?  That's disheartening.

Aww. Be nice to the Falcon! But there's only one ship in the 'verse prettier. ;)

Speaking of Christmas presents, I've wished for a conclusion to ASoIaF for many Christmases now, but something's different this year.

I'm almost getting to the point where I don't want the series to end. I mean, really? It's been so long, and so many of us have had to build up an ending in our own heads to keep sane, that I think no matter what happens in any books that may or may not get released between now and the end of time, it'll be a disappointment. Sort of like how JKR's seventh Harry Potter book wound up being "mreh" at best, and got worse the more "hardcore" of a fan you were.

So, for Christmas this year, I know I'm not getting A Dance With Dragons. But... I'm not sure I want Santa to bring it to us next year, either. The best fantasy, as always, remains in the mind, and I'm starting to get comfortable with the idea of this series remaining officially unfinished - I get to finish it in my mind, the way I'd like it best. Maybe that's what Lord Martin's plan was all along.

>Damn. If only I'd finished DANCE. I might be able to afford it.<

That makes me feel a lot better about the banjo I bought (and never learned to play) with the money from my first book.
I have to throw down with the crew of "firefly" their ship Serenity is small but fierce. finish dance and i will help you buy a space ship and so will all my addicted friends promise.
comments.subject: cruising

comments.article: J.K. Rowling should have gotten it for you as a Christmas present. Ghu knows she owes you one.

"Damn. If only I'd finished DANCE. I might be able to afford it."

hahahaha nice... see my line of thought would be if only you'd finished DANCE, you could get working on WINDS.

Not play spaceship for the next few years.

I mean my whole life revolves around these books!!!!

LOL kidding :)
comments.subject: LOL

comments.article:
I am getting depressed that it is not out. I am starting to doubt this series will ever be completed. I have been patient these last years and haven't posted or complained, but it is getting hard.

I am pumped about the HBO pilot and have very high hopes for it. But I have been reading this saga for 10 years and for the first time am starting to believe it will never be completed.

I am a writer myself and know it can be extremely difficult getting the ass in the seat sometimes. And it is true that there is an abundance of great writing out there (I just finished a pair: 'The Executioner's Song' by Mailer and 'The Road' by Cormac McCarthy; both are stunning books).

But I want Dance to come out and am about ready to show up at Mr. Martin's doorstep with my fountain pen and papers to lend a helping hand. Or, at the very least, turn of the Jets game and pull him away from the Daily Kos for a few minutes to get this wrapped up. I say this in jest, of course, George.

But seriously (to quote Mr. Wolf), pretty please, with sugar on top, finish the fucking book. ;-)
comments.subject: Speaking of Dance....

comments.article: Yeah GRRM, what he or she said.  Well spoken Hotpie
comments.subject: Re: Speaking of Dance....

comments.article: Ha, Paris, I think this post is directed at you! Biiiiiiiiig hint there! Just don't tell him you're Santa!
I'm a big fan a the firefly-class ship from Firefly. Not really classic SF television, but a damn good series and a real cool-looking ship.

Well not poverty, but the downpayment for my house was less than this thing will end up going for.  I love Forbidden Planet, and this would be one of the coolest things ever to own.  I hope a museum ends up with it someday so us commoners can go see it.
comments.subject: Alas for my poverty

comments.article: I will argue until the day I die that the Excelsior class Enterprise-B is the coolest spaceship to ever be glued together for a movie.

comments.upictitle: A Rake at the Gates of Hell: House
comments.article: It's beautiful, I must admit. A close second to the movie-refit version of the Enterprise.
The Falcon wins.
Sorry to disagree but there ain't nothing better than the Millennium Falcon!  Nothing!

I have a certain fondness for War Rocket Ajax from Flash Gordon, a sort-of 1980s-ified version of the old serial spaceships. The Klingong Bird of Prey is also quite nifty.

For me, it's the Imperial Star Destroyer all the way. And yes, it is just a giant triangle with an aircraft carrier's conning tower on top. I like it.
Ooh, and the original Battlestar Galactica (1978 vintage) and the new Battlestar Pegasus (2006 version) are both pretty cool as well.
